author: Staff Reporter
text:
A large number of Chennai students took part in a ‘study abroad’ education fair organised by IDP Education on Sunday and explored courses offered by universities and institutions in the U.S., New Zealand, Canada and the United Kingdom (U.K.).

Ashish Arora, Director, Sales and Operations, IDP India, said that there had been a sustained interest among Chennai students in pursuing higher education abroad over the years.

“While they used to be interested in going to the U.K. and Australia, apart from the U.S., we are seeing an increase in interest for universities in Canada this year. The country has been very welcoming to Indian students and the quality of education and the jobs offered have been a draw,” he said. Representatives from over 80 universities and institutions from the U.S., New Zealand, Canada and the U.K., interacted with the students.

Engineering preferred

“There still remains a preference for engineering and IT, followed by courses in business,” said Radhika Somasundaram, Head of Sales, IDP Chennai and Kerala.

Apart from Chennai, the fair will also be held in Kolkata, Ludhiana, Chandigarh, Gurgaon, New Delhi and Coimbatore.
title: Canada draws more Chennai students
